intro: Berkheya atractyloides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features a rosette of gray-green, woolly leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its succulent leaves and striking flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
